title: How to keep company property from walking out the door
content:
Just about everyone has opened the door for a fellow employee struggling with a box or piece of equipment as he or she exits the building. What if this everyday activity is not as it appears?

Employee theft is sometimes done right under the organization’s nose, during core business hours, and under the guise of business as usual.

In most cases, when you see an employee putting cardboard boxes into a personal vehicle, the individual really is grabbing empty boxes for moving or personal storage.
